title: Type Specimens Online
content:
Hi,  
I’ve been reading this forum for a while now but never written anything.  
Now i need your help though.

I need to find type specimens, and preferably a lot of them.

Do you know any nice type specimen websites?

So far i’ve only found some websites with really old specimens. I need to find some more recent ones. Like from the 60s to now.

Thanks.

 [‹ TDC2 2008 Results](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011133524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42446 "Go to previous forum topic") [Great typography in the Washington Post :-/ ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011133524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42746 "Go to next forum topic")
author: gudmundur ulfarsson

comments.content: Check out the producers, the foundries.

Hi Gundi, Claus here.  
Have a go on Flickr also. I’ve seen ATP specimen books there and other more ancient tidbits photographed page by page.

Thanks guys,

I’ve been checking the foundries and Flickr and it helps a lot.

Hi Gundi, Some links of type specimens that I found (some here in typophile).

[http://tug.org/levienfonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011133524/http:/tug.org/levienfonts/)

The archive.org has some intersting collection of print material with lots of type specimens for download. Check it out at  
 [http://www.archive.org/search.php?query=subject%3A%22Type%20and%20type-founding%22](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011133524/http:/www.archive.org/search.php?query=subject%3A%22Type%20and%20type-founding%22)

António
